BindAutoSnapshotPolicy.document: This API is used to bind one or multiple file systems to a snapshot policy. A file system can be bound to only one policy.
BindAutoSnapshotPolicy.name: Binds a file system to a snapshot policy

CreateAutoSnapshotPolicy.document: This API is used to create a scheduled snapshot policy.
CreateAutoSnapshotPolicy.name: Creates a scheduled snapshot policy

CreateCfsFileSystem.document: This API is used to create a file system.
CreateCfsFileSystem.name: Creates a file system

CreateCfsPGroup.document: This API is used to create a permission group.
CreateCfsPGroup.name: Creates a permission group

CreateCfsRule.document: This API is used to create a permission group rule.
CreateCfsRule.name: Creates a permission group rule

CreateCfsSnapshot.document: This API is used to create a file system snapshot.
CreateCfsSnapshot.name: Creates a file system snapshot

CreateMigrationTask.document:
This API is used to create a migration task.
To use this API, submit a ticket for us to add you to the allowlist.
CreateMigrationTask.name: Creates a migration task

DeleteAutoSnapshotPolicy.document: This API is used to delete a scheduled snapshot policy.
DeleteAutoSnapshotPolicy.name: Deletes a snapshot policy

DeleteCfsFileSystem.document: This API is used to delete a file system.
DeleteCfsFileSystem.name: Deletes a file system

DeleteCfsPGroup.document: This API is used to delete a permission group.
DeleteCfsPGroup.name: Deletes a permission group

DeleteCfsRule.document: This API is used to delete a permission group rule.
DeleteCfsRule.name: Deletes a permission group rule

DeleteCfsSnapshot.document: This API is used to delete a file system snapshot.
DeleteCfsSnapshot.name: Deletes a file system snapshot

DeleteMigrationTask.document:
This API is used to delete a migration task.
To use this API, submit a ticket for us to add you to the allowlist.
DeleteMigrationTask.name: Deletes a migration task

DeleteMountTarget.document: This API is used to delete a mount target.
DeleteMountTarget.name: Deletes a mount target

DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicies.document: This API is used to query the list of scheduled snapshot policies of a file system.
DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicies.name: Queries the list of snapshot policies of a file system

DescribeAvailableZoneInfo.document: This API is used to query the availability of a region.
DescribeAvailableZoneInfo.name: Queries the availability of a region

DescribeBucketList.document:
This API is used to get the list of data source buckets.
To use this API, submit a ticket for us to add you to the allowlist.
DescribeBucketList.name: Gets the bucket list

DescribeCfsFileSystemClients.document: This API is used to query clients on which this file system is mounted. To do so, the client needs to have the CFS monitoring plugin installed.
DescribeCfsFileSystemClients.name: Queries file system clients

DescribeCfsFileSystems.document: This API is used to query file systems.
DescribeCfsFileSystems.name: Queries file systems

DescribeCfsPGroups.document: This API is used to query the list of permission groups.
DescribeCfsPGroups.name: Queries the list of permission groups

DescribeCfsRules.document: This API is used to query the list of permission group rules.
DescribeCfsRules.name: Queries permission group rules

DescribeCfsServiceStatus.document: This API is used to query the status of the CFS service.
DescribeCfsServiceStatus.name: Queries the status of the CFS service

DescribeCfsSnapshotOverview.document: This API is used to get the snapshot overview of a file system.
DescribeCfsSnapshotOverview.name: Gets the snapshot overview of a file system

DescribeCfsSnapshots.document: This API is used to query the list of snapshots of a file system.
DescribeCfsSnapshots.name: Queries the list of snapshots

DescribeMigrationTasks.document:
This API is used to get the list of migration tasks.
To use this API, submit a ticket for us to add you to the allowlist.
DescribeMigrationTasks.name: Gets the migration task list

DescribeMountTargets.document: This API is used to query the mount targets of a file system.
DescribeMountTargets.name: Queries the mount targets of a file system

DescribeSnapshotOperationLogs.document: This API is used to query the operation logs of a snapshot.
DescribeSnapshotOperationLogs.name: Queries the operation logs of a snapshot

ModifyFileSystemAutoScaleUpRule.document: This API is used to modify the scaling policy of a file system.
ModifyFileSystemAutoScaleUpRule.name: Modifies the automatic scaling policy of a file system

ScaleUpFileSystem.document: This API is used to scale up a Turbo file system.
ScaleUpFileSystem.name: Scales up a file system

SignUpCfsService.document: This API is used to activate the CFS service.
SignUpCfsService.name: Activates the CFS service

StopMigrationTask.document:
This API is used to stop a migration task.
To use this API, submit a ticket for us to add you to the allowlist.
StopMigrationTask.name: Stops a migration task

UnbindAutoSnapshotPolicy.document: This API is used to unbind a snapshot policy from a file system.
UnbindAutoSnapshotPolicy.name: Unbinds a snapshot policy

UpdateAutoSnapshotPolicy.document: This API is used to update a scheduled snapshot policy.
UpdateAutoSnapshotPolicy.name: Updates a scheduled snapshot policy

UpdateCfsFileSystemName.document: This API is used to update a file system name.
UpdateCfsFileSystemName.name: Updates a file system name

UpdateCfsFileSystemPGroup.document: This API is used to update the permission group used by a file system.
UpdateCfsFileSystemPGroup.name: Updates the permission group for a file system

UpdateCfsFileSystemSizeLimit.document: This API is used to update the capacity limit of a file system.
UpdateCfsFileSystemSizeLimit.name: Updates the capacity limit of a file system

UpdateCfsPGroup.document: This API is used to update the information of a permission group.
UpdateCfsPGroup.name: Updates the information of a permission group

UpdateCfsRule.document: This API is used to update a permission rule.
UpdateCfsRule.name: Updates a permission group rule

UpdateCfsSnapshotAttribute.document: This API is used to update the name and retention period of a file system snapshot.
UpdateCfsSnapshotAttribute.name: Updates the information of a file system snapshot

members.document: The specific day of the week on which to create a snapshot. This parameter is mutually exclusive with `DayOfMonth` and `IntervalDays`.
members.name: DayOfWeek

members.document: The hour of a day at which to regularly back up the snapshot
members.name: Hour

members.document: Whether to activate the scheduled snapshot feature
members.name: IsActivated

members.document:
The specific day of the month on which to create a snapshot. This parameter is mutually exclusive with `DayOfWeek` and `IntervalDays`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DayOfMonth

members.document:
The snapshot interval (1 to 365 days). This parameter is mutually exclusive with `DayOfWeek` and `DayOfMonth`.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: IntervalDays

members.document: Sale status. Valid values: sale_out (sold out), saling (purchasable), no_saling (non-purchasable)
members.name: SaleStatus

members.document: Protocol type. Valid values: NFS, CIFS
members.name: Protocol

members.document: Region availability. If a region has at least one AZ where resources are purchasable, this value will be `AVAILABLE`; otherwise, it will be `UNAVAILABLE`
members.name: RegionStatus

members.document: Storage class. Valid values: `SD` (standard storage) and `HP` (high-performance storage)
members.name: Type

members.document: Indicates whether prepaid is supported. `true`: yes; `false`: no
members.name: Prepayment

members.document: Chinese and English names of an AZ
members.name: ZoneName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Bucket region
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Region

members.document: The time point when to repeat the snapshot operation
members.name: Hour

members.document: The day of the week on which to repeat the snapshot operation
members.name: DayOfWeek

members.document: The specific day (day 1 to day 31) of the month on which to automatically create a snapshot.
members.name: DayOfMonth

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: AZ name, such as "ap-beijing-1". For the list of regions and AZs, please see [Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/product/582/13225?from_cn_redirect=1)
members.name: Zone

members.document: Network type. Valid values: `VPC` and `CCN`. Select `VPC` for a Standard or High-Performance file system, and `CCN` for a Standard Turbo or High-Performance Turbo one.
members.name: NetInterface

members.document: File system protocol. Valid values: `NFS`, `CIFS`, `TURBO`. If this parameter is left empty, `NFS` is used by default. For the Turbo series, you must set this parameter to `TURBO`.
members.name: Protocol

members.document: Storage type of the file system. Valid values: `SD` (Standard), `HP` (High-Performance), `TB` (Standard Turbo), and `TP` (High-Performance Turbo). Default value: `SD`.
members.name: StorageType

members.document: VPC ID. This field is required if network type is VPC.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: Subnet ID. This field is required if network type is VPC.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document: IP address (this parameter supports only the VPC network type, and the Turbo series is not supported). If this parameter is left empty, a random IP in the subnet will be assigned.
members.name: MountIP

members.document: A unique string supplied by the client to ensure that the request is idempotent. Its maximum length is 64 ASCII characters. If this parameter is not specified, the idempotency of the request cannot be guaranteed. This string is valid for 2 hours.
members.name: ClientToken

members.document: CCN instance ID (required if the network type is CCN)
members.name: CcnId

members.document: CCN IP range used by the CFS (required if the network type is CCN), which cannot conflict with other IP ranges bound in CCN
members.name: CidrBlock

members.document: File system capacity, in GiB (required for the Turbo series). For Standard Turbo, the minimum purchase required is 40,960 GiB (40 TiB) and the expansion increment is 20,480 GiB (20 TiB). For High-Performance Turbo, the minimum purchase required is 20,480 GiB (20 TiB) and the expansion increment is 10,240 GiB (10 TiB).
members.name: Capacity

members.document: Storage used by the file system, in bytes
members.name: SizeByte

members.document: Whether a file system is encrypted
members.name: Encrypted

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Permission group name, which can contain 1-64 Chinese characters, letters, numbers, underscores, or dashes
members.name: Name

members.document: Permission group description, which can contain 1-255 characters
members.name: DescInfo

members.document: The number of file systems bound to this permission group
members.name: BindCfsNum

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: You can enter a single IP or IP range, such as 10.1.10.11 or 10.10.1.0/24. The default visiting address is `*`, indicating that all IPs are allowed. Please note that you need to enter the CVM instance's private IP here.
members.name: AuthClientIp

members.document: Rule priority. Value range: 1-100. 1 represents the highest priority, while 100 the lowest
members.name: Priority

members.document: Read/write permission. Valid values: RO (read-only), RW (read & write). Default value: RO
members.name: RWPermission

members.document: User permission. Valid values: all_squash, no_all_squash, root_squash, no_root_squash. Specifically, all_squash: any visiting user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_all_squash: a visiting user will be first matched with a local user, and if the match fails, it will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; root_squash: a visiting root user will be mapped to an anonymous user or user group; no_root_squash: a visiting root user will be allowed to maintain root account permissions. Default value: root_squash.
members.name: UserPermission

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Migration type. Valid values: `0` (bucket) and `1` (list). Default value: `0`.
members.name: MigrationType

members.name: SrcSecretId

members.document: SecretKey of the data source account
members.name: SrcSecretKey

members.document: Overwrite policy for files with the same name. Valid values: `0` (retain the file with the latest modified time), `1` (overwrite); and `2` (not overwrite). Default value: `0`.
members.name: CoverType

members.document: Data source service provider. Valid values: `COS` (Tencent Cloud COS), `OSS` (Alibaba Cloud OSS), and `OBS` (Huawei Cloud OBS).
members.name: SrcService

members.document: Data source bucket name. Specify at least one of the bucket name or address.
members.name: BucketName

members.document: Data source bucket address. Specify at least one of the bucket name or address.
members.name: BucketAddress

members.document: List address. This parameter is required if `MigrationType` is set to `1` (list).
members.name: ListAddress

members.document: Source bucket path, which defaults to `/`
members.name: BucketPath

- creating
- mounting
